title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.\n$$-7x+6y=-10$$\n$$x-6y=22$$
speech: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations.\n minus 7 x plus 6 y is equal to, negative 10 \n x, minus 6 y is equal to 22

x, minus 6 y is equal to 22

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$-6x=12$$\n$$x=-2$$
speech: Add the x's, y's, and constants.  y  will be eliminated and then solve for  x .\n negative 6 x is equal to 12 \n x, is equal to negative 2

will be eliminated and then solve for   x

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text:
Substitute $$x=-2$$ into the first equation, $$-7x+6y=-10$$. Then solve for $$y$$.
$$-7x+6y=-10$$
$$-7\left(-2ight)+6y=-10$$
$$14+6y=-10$$
$$6y=-24$$
$$y=-4$$
speech:
Substitute  x is equal to negative 2  into the first equation,  negative 7 x plus 6 y is equal to negative 10 . Then solve for  y .
 negative 7 x plus 6 y is equal to negative 10 
, negative 7 times negative 2 plus 6 y is equal to, negative 10

 y, is equal to negative 4

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(-2,-4)$$.
